The family (History Tracers (2024): Family) visualization page of History Tracers (2024), is organized into four main sections:

  • Patriarch/Matriarch list: This section comprises a list of patriarchs/matriarchs who either named the family or resided in a particular region.
  • People organized by patriarch/matriarch's family: When readers click on a family name or region from the first section, they are directed to a segment that introduces the first documented individual, along with their descendants and concise personal histories. Texts supported by primary sources are displayed in normal font style, while hypotheses lacking verifiable sources are presented in italic font style.
    Each historical account is accompanied by its corresponding primary sources and references, which can be accessed with a simple click.
  • Primary sources and publications: A common misconception among genealogy researchers is assuming that an individual who authored a book adhered strictly to the scientific method (History Tracers (2024): Scientific Method) when documenting their own family history, thus eliminating the need for further scrutiny. To address this misconception, the page distinguishes between primary sources that unequivocally validate an individual's existence and other references found in publications such as noble genealogies. Religious texts are given a separate, respectful section; however, if these texts were authored during the lifetime of the individuals mentioned, they may also be cited as primary sources.
  • Family tree and citations: On the right-hand side of the page, a partial family tree is displayed for the selected individual, accompanied by primary sources and references.
